title: Director, National Center for Supercomputing Applications, Grainger Distinguished Chair in Engineering
office: Siebel School of Computing and Data Science, University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign, Urbana, Illinois
biography: William D. Gropp is a renowned computer scientist and engineer, currently serving as the Director of the National Center for Supercomputing Applications and Grainger Distinguished Chair in Engineering at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign.
researchStatement: My research focuses on high-performance computing, parallel programming models, and scalable numerical algorithms for solving complex problems in science and engineering.

researchInterests.description: Development of scalable numerical algorithms and parallel programming models for large-scale scientific simulations.
Design and implementation of parallel programming systems for distributed memory architectures.

publications.title: PETSc: Portable, Extensible Toolkit for Scientific Computation

teachingHonors.honor: HPCWire Readers Choice Award for Outstanding Leadership in HPC
